required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Single Ascending Dose Pharmacology Study of Anaprazole in Healthy Chinese Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Randomized, Double-blinded, Placebo Parallel Controlled Phase 1 Study to Evaluate the Safety and Pharmacology of Single Ascending Dose Administration of Anaprazole in Healthy Chinese Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: A single-center, randomized, open-labeled, 2×2 crossover phase 1 study to evaluate the pharmakinetics effect of high fat food to single dose administration of Anaprazole in healthy Chinese male subjects. 14 health male subjects is divided to A group (n=7) and B group (n=7). 2 periods (7 days) cross-over design, anaprazole 40mg single dose, one is fasting oral administration before breakfast, the other is oral administration 30 minutes after breakfast with high fat food.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events and serious adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v5.0
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing informed consent to study completion, 8 days post-dose
primary_outcome.description: All adverse events will be monitored in each subject

arm_group.description: Single ascendinng dose (2.5mg, 5mg, 10mg, 20mg, 40mg, 80mg, 120mg, 160mg), fasting oral administration.
